014package org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer;
015
016import java.lang.annotation.ElementType;
017import java.lang.annotation.Retention;
018import java.lang.annotation.RetentionPolicy;
019import java.lang.annotation.Target;
020
021import org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.SqlStatement;
022import org.jdbi.v3.sqlobject.customizer.internal.BindListFactory;
023
024import static org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.EmptyHandling.BLANK;
025import static org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.EmptyHandling.DEFINE_NULL;
026import static org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.EmptyHandling.NULL_KEYWORD;
027
028/**
029 * Binds each value in the annotated {@link Iterable} or array/varargs argument, and defines a named attribute as a
030 * comma-separated list of each bound parameter name. Common use cases:
031 * <pre>
032 * &#64;SqlQuery("select * from things where id in (&lt;ids&gt;)")
033 * List&lt;Thing&gt; getThings(@BindList int... ids)
034 *
035 * &#64;SqlUpdate("insert into things (&lt;columnNames&gt;) values (&lt;values&gt;)")
036 * void insertThings(@DefineList List&lt;String&gt; columnNames, @BindList List&lt;Object&gt; values)
037 * </pre>
038 * <p>
039 * Throws IllegalArgumentException if the argument is not an array or Iterable. How null and empty collections are handled can be configured with onEmpty:EmptyHandling - throws IllegalArgumentException by default.
040 */
041@Retention(RetentionPolicy.RUNTIME)
042@Target({ElementType.PARAMETER})
043@SqlStatementCustomizingAnnotation(BindListFactory.class)
044public @interface BindList {
045    /**
046     * The attribute name to define. If omitted, the name of the annotated parameter is used. It is an error to omit
047     * the name when there is no parameter naming information in your class files.
048     *
049     * @return the attribute name.
050     */
051    String value() default "";
052
053    /**
054     * What to do when the argument is null or empty.
055     *
056     * @return The strategy for handling an empty list. By default, throw an {@link IllegalArgumentException}.
057     *
058     * @see EmptyHandling
059     */
060    EmptyHandling onEmpty() default BindList.EmptyHandling.THROW;
061
062    // TODO jdbi4 remove this duplicate of `core` EmptyHandling
063    /**
064     * describes what needs to be done if the passed argument is null or empty
065     */
066    enum EmptyHandling {
067        /**
068         * <p>Define "".</p>
069         *
070         * {@code select * from things where x in ()}
071         */
072        VOID(BLANK),
073        /**
074         * <p>Define "null", useful e.g. in postgresql where "in ()" is invalid syntax.</p>
075         *
076         * {@code select * from things where x in (null)}
077         *
078         * @deprecated vaguely named in light of new additions, use {@link EmptyHandling#NULL_STRING} instead
079         */
080        @Deprecated
081        NULL(NULL_KEYWORD),
082        /**
083         * <p>Define "null", useful e.g. in postgresql where "in ()" is invalid syntax.</p>
084         *
085         * {@code select * from things where x in (null)}
086         */
087        NULL_STRING(NULL_KEYWORD),
088        /**
089         * <p>Define {@code null}, leaving the result up to the {@link org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.TemplateEngine} to decide.</p>
090         *
091         * This value was specifically added to <a href="https://github.com/jdbi/jdbi/issues/1377">make conditionals work better with <code>StringTemplate</code></a>.
092         */
093        NULL_VALUE(DEFINE_NULL),
094        /**
095         * Throw IllegalArgumentException.
096         */
097        THROW(org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.EmptyHandling.THROW);
098
099        private final org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.EmptyHandling coreImpl;
100
101        EmptyHandling(org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.EmptyHandling coreImpl) {
102            this.coreImpl = coreImpl;
103        }
104
105        /**
106         * @deprecated legacy internal API
107         */
108        @Deprecated
109        public void define(SqlStatement stmt, String name) {
110            coreImpl.accept(stmt, name);
111        }
112
113        public org.jdbi.v3.core.statement.EmptyHandling getCoreImpl() {
114            return coreImpl;
115        }
116    }
117}
